item.title: Yes, You ARE Overpaying For Your Phone and Data Lines
item.description:
By: John Shepler With economic uncertainty looming, businesses must prioritize survival. Focusing on expense reduction is crucial when future income is unpredictable. Telecom expenses, including data, phone, and internet services, often represent a significant monthly cost. It’s highly probable that you’re overpaying for these services. Whoâ€™s Gouging Me? You’re likely not being cheated. Think of it like those hidden costs that drain your budget without you realizing it. First, Get Rid of the Waste..

item.title: Robert Walters believes that it is possible to both attract and retain tech talent
item.description:
A recent survey by Robert Walters reveals that the tech talent shortage is significantly impacting businesses, with 70% of hiring managers requiring three months or more to fill tech positions. This shortage is hindering product development speed and highlighting the urgent need for effective talent acquisition strategies. The survey, conducted across Southeast Asia, emphasizes the difficulty of finding skilled tech professionals, despite recognizing its importance for business success. In response, Robert Walters has created a guidebook, “5 Lessons in Tackling the Tech Talent Shortage,” offering valuable insights from industry experts...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/robert-walters-believes-that-it-is-possible-to-both-attract-and-retain-tech-talent/

item.title: If you have digital or tech skills, chances are your salary is above average
item.description:
Source: Willis Towers Watson. Report cover. The financial sector, particularly in digital roles, is experiencing salary stability due to a high demand for tech professionals. This trend persists despite overall economic weakness in other industries, including banking, according to the global advisory firm Willis Towers Watson. Businesses across all sectors are becoming progressively reliant on data and technology, and the banking industry is no exception. This shift has resulted in a talent competition where technological expertise is more valuable than financial background...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/if-you-have-digital-or-tech-skills-chances-are-your-salary-is-above-average/

item.title: A new tech and innovation business club has been introduced in Singapore
item.description:
SPECTRUM, a curated tech and innovation business club, has been established in Singapore. The organization, co-founded by Cheryl Lee and Shirley Crystal Chua, aims to create a globally connected ecosystem for businesses seeking to expand into Asia by providing expert advice, necessary resources, and strategic networks. SPECTRUM has partnered with Golden Equator and Mistletoe to form a collaborative network of seven strategic groups: innovators, learning institutions, executors, backers, enablers, government agencies, and ecosystem builders and partners...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/a-new-tech-and-innovation-business-club-has-been-introduced-in-singapore/

item.title: IMDA collaborates with telecommunications companies and financial institutions to assist small and medium-sized enterprises
item.description:
Seven partnerships between the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA), telecommunications companies, and financial institutions aim to accelerate the adoption of digital technologies by small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). These partnerships will focus on providing SMEs with access to pre-approved, secure, and interoperable solutions in cybersecurity and data analytics. Launched in 2017, the SMEs Go Digital program helps SMEs adopt appropriate digital technologies at each stage of their growth. SMEs are a significant part of Singapore’s economy, contributing to roughly 50% of its gross domestic product and employing two-thirds of its workforce...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/imda-collaborates-with-telecommunications-companies-and-financial-institutions-to-assist-small-and-medium-sized-enterprises/

item.title: The Singapore Computer Society reveals the top 10 tech companies to work for in 2017
item.description:
The Singapore Computer Society (SCS), the largest professional organization for infocomm and digital media professionals in the country, has revealed the winners of its “Best Tech Company to Work For Award”. The announcement took place at the SCS’s annual Tech3 Forum conference. This award recognizes four organizations out of the ten “Best Tech Companies to Work For” as overall winners. These companies have developed innovative practices and demonstrated workplace excellence within the infocomm and digital media (ICM) industry...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-singapore-computer-society-reveals-the-top-10-tech-companies-to-work-for-in-2017/

item.title: Singapore companies are considering hiring senior technology professionals to address the shortage of talent
item.description:
Despite job market growth, a 2017 survey by the Singapore Infocomm Technology Federation (SiTF) reveals that the infocommunications (ICM) industry struggles to find talent with the right IT and business skills. The survey of 181 companies found that 75% consider recruiting suitable talent their biggest challenge. This problem particularly affects startups (91%), followed by small and medium enterprises (SMEs) at 76% and multinational corporations (MNCs) at 75%. Source: SITF. The talent situation in Singapore for ICM...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/singapore-companies-are-considering-hiring-senior-technology-professionals-to-address-the-shortage-of-talent/
